newsitem.title: USA: U.S. corporate bonds weaken, correction continues.
newsitem.headline: U.S. corporate bonds weaken, correction continues.

text.p: Prices of U.S. investment-grade and high-yield corporate bonds continued to weaken on Tuesday as market players expressed their concerns about the direction of the interest rates and the equity market, trading sources said.
"Sellers were better than buyers," said one high-grade trader. "Corporate spreads are all over the place."

Another trader estimated spreads widened about two basis on average across the high-grade market. He said selling pressure was exacerbated by institutional accounts cleaning up their portfolios at the end of the month and quarter.
